TypeSignature.Value: .class public auto ansi abstract beforefieldinit HttpBrowserCapabilitiesBase extends System.Object implements class System.Web.UI.IFilterResolutionService
Public MustInherit Class HttpBrowserCapabilitiesBase Implements IFilterResolutionService
public ref class HttpBrowserCapabilitiesBase abstract : System::Web::UI::IFilterResolutionService

Docs.summary: Serves as the base class for classes that enable the server to gather information about the capabilities of the browser that made the current request.

remarks.format:
## Remarks The <xref:System.Web.HttpBrowserCapabilitiesBase> class is an abstract class that contains the same members as the <xref:System.Web.HttpBrowserCapabilities> class. The <xref:System.Web.HttpBrowserCapabilitiesBase> class enables you to create derived classes that are like the <xref:System.Web.HttpBrowserCapabilities> class, but that you can customize and that work outside the ASP.NET pipeline. When you perform unit testing, you typically use a derived class to implement members with customized behavior that fulfills the scenario you are testing.
The <xref:System.Web.HttpBrowserCapabilitiesWrapper> class derives from the <xref:System.Web.HttpBrowserCapabilitiesBase> class. The <xref:System.Web.HttpBrowserCapabilitiesWrapper> class serves as a wrapper for the <xref:System.Web.HttpBrowserCapabilities> class. At run time, you typically use an instance of the <xref:System.Web.HttpBrowserCapabilitiesWrapper> class to call members of the <xref:System.Web.HttpBrowserCapabilities> object.

Docs.summary: Initializes the class for use by an inherited class instance. This constructor can only be called by an inherited class.

MemberSignature.Value: Public Overridable ReadOnly Property ActiveXControls As Boolean
public: virtual property bool ActiveXControls { bool get(); };

Docs.summary: When overridden in a derived class, gets a value that indicates whether the browser is capable of supporting ActiveX controls.
Docs.value: if the browser can support ActiveX controls; otherwise, .

MemberSignature.Value: Public Overridable ReadOnly Property VBScript As Boolean
public: virtual property bool VBScript { bool get(); };

Docs.summary: When overridden in a derived class, gets a value that indicates whether the browser supports Visual Basic Scripting edition (VBScript).
Docs.value:
if the browser supports VBScript; otherwise, .
This property does not indicate whether VBScript is currently enabled in the browser, only whether the browser can support VBScript.

MemberSignature.Value: Public Overridable ReadOnly Property Version As String
public: virtual property System::String ^ Version { System::String ^ get(); };

Docs.summary: When overridden in a derived class, gets the full version number (integer and decimal) of the browser as a string.
Docs.value: The full version number of the browser as a string.

MemberSignature.Value: Public Overridable ReadOnly Property W3CDomVersion As Version
public: virtual property Version ^ W3CDomVersion { Version ^ get(); };

Docs.value: The number of the W3C XML DOM version number that the browser supports.

public: virtual property bool Win16 { bool get(); };
